result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Vincent Schroeble Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael Vincent Schroeble in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Defendant Michael Vincent Schroeble in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 76 days in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 76 days served FOR A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.  

Court ordered defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 08-17-2015 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.  
Court ordered restitution set at $0.00.

Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court, defendant Michael Vincent Schroeble not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with all Target stores in Milwaukee County.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael Vincent Schroeble in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Michael Vincent Schroeble in custody.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Michael Vincent Schroeble Jr
Current: 3839 S 93rd Street, Milwaukee, WI United States  (Effective: 04-04-2015)
Prior: 1820 West Wells Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209 United States
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
